UnnecessaryCast.description:
Description

Minimum Language Version:Java 1.5

Detects casts which could be removed as the operand of the cast is already suitable
for the context type. For instance, in the following:

The cast is unnecessary. This is becauseStringalready is a subtype of bothComparableandObject.

This will also flag casts that can be avoided because of the autoboxing feature of Java 5.

The literal would be autoboxed toIntegeranyway.

Example(s):

Use this rule by referencing it:
UnnecessaryCast.option: This rule has no specific options.
